qas.question: On what date did the CTRC approve the shut down of CBC's analogue transmitters?
On what date were CBC's remaining analogue transmitters shut down?
How many analogue transmitters were shut down on July 31, 2012?
When did the CRTC order the shutdown of the analogue transmitters?
When did the CRTC shut down the 620 analogue transmitters?
How many transmitters did the CRTC think were appropriate to leave operable?

plausible_answers.text: it cannot direct the CBC or any other broadcaster to continue to operate its stations and transmitters

qas.question: What did the director of the CRTC regret not being able to do?

context: On <a0_0><b3_0>July 17, 2012<b3_0/><a0_0/>, the CRTC approved the shut down of CBC's analogue transmitters, noting that "while the Commission has the discretion to refuse to revoke broadcasting licences, even on application from a licensee, <b6_0>it cannot direct the CBC or any other broadcaster to continue to operate its stations and transmitters<b6_0/>." On <a1_0><b4_0>July 31, 2012<b4_0/><a1_0/>, at around 11:59 p.m. in each time zone, the remaining <a2_0>620<a2_0/> analogue transmitters were shut down, leaving the network with <b5_0>27<b5_0/> digital television transmitters across the country, and some transmitters operated by some affiliated stations.
